comments.body: it's unusual to accept a path but only allow certain paths... what if i want to test a version in my /tmp/ directory?
in any case if you keep this restriction the message should say what the restriction is

`FormatException`s are accompanied by usage printout, which explains the restriction.

Alternatively, we could have a separate option for file paths (`-f` maybe?), lift the `bin/tasks` restriction and simplify the logic (and docs).

LMK which you prefer. It's an easy change.
Either's fine by me. Two options means you now have to decide which one takes precedence, or catch both being set, etc. So it's not necessarily a win.

"Use this to select a specific version of the engine if you have built multiple engine targets"

This makes it sound like you don't have to use this if you don't have multiple engines in /out but you have to use one regardless to use local engine.
This is copy pasted from the help text for `flutter run`.

comments.body: suggestion:  verbose with default to true so no-verbose would make it silent.

`taskName: luciBuilder`

Somewhere there's going to be this friction in how we connect a DeviceLab test runner taskName and a Cocoon datastore taskName. I chose here to minimize confusion as this is one of the few areas in the code where Cocoon and DeviceLab test runner are connected.

Can we separate the functionality with commands? eg 

* run.dart test ...
* run.dart upload_metrics ...

That way we can extend this file later with a compile command to optimize the resources usage.

I created a separate `bin/test_runner.dart` to reduce the complexity of the migration, and only added `upload-metrics` for now. Once we have migrated off of Cocoon agents, we can remove the global args code in `bin/run.dart`.

I can follow up in another PR with the `test` command.
